DSS_METRIC_DESCRIPTIONS.METRIC_DESCRIPTION: CF Components
Number of ColdFusion Components
CF Templates
Number of ColdFusion Templates
CF Functions
Number of ColdFusion Functions
CF Queries
Number of ColdFusion Queries
ColdFusion: Avoid Functions with a high Fan-out
The higher the number of reference to an Artifact, the more difficult the maintenance as all referencing Artifacts will have to be updated or tested.

Avoid Artifacts with High Fan-In (Fan-In < X). The Fan-In of an Artifact is the number of other Artifacts that are referencing it. When computing the Fan-In of an Artifact, multiple accesses to it from the same Artifact are counted as one access. The threshold level is a parameter that can be changed at will.
Reduce the number of references to the Artifact
ColdFusion: Avoid Functions with a high Fan-in
The higher the number of referenced Artifacts, the more difficult the maintenance and evolution as all updates in referenced Artifacts will have to be tested and taken into account.

Avoid Artifacts with High Fan-Out (Fan-Out < X). The Fan-out of an Artifact is the number of other Artifacts that are referenced in it. When computing the Fan-Out of an Artifact, multiple accesses to the same component of an Artifact are counted as one access. The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will. Artifacts are
Reduce the number of referenced Artifacts
ColdFusion: Avoid Templates with a high Fan-out
The higher the number of reference to an Artifact, the more difficult the maintenance as all referencing Artifacts will have to be updated or tested.

Avoid Artifacts with High Fan-In (Fan-In < X). The Fan-In of an Artifact is the number of other Artifacts that are referencing it. When computing the Fan-In of an Artifact, multiple accesses to it from the same Artifact are counted as one access. The threshold level is a parameter that can be changed at will.
Reduce the number of references to the Artifact
This report lists all Templates with High Fan-In. It provides the following information: Template full name, Fan-In value
Number of Templates
ColdFusion: Avoid Templates with a high Fan-in
The higher the number of referenced Artifacts, the more difficult the maintenance and evolution as all updates in referenced Artifacts will have to be tested and taken into account.

Avoid Artifacts with High Fan-Out (Fan-Out < X). The Fan-out of an Artifact is the number of other Artifacts that are referenced in it. When computing the Fan-Out of an Artifact, multiple accesses to the same component of an Artifact are counted as one access. The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will. Artifacts are
Reduce the number of referenced Artifacts
This report lists all Template with a Fan-Out greater than X It provides the following information: Template full name, Fan-Out value
Number of Templates
ColdFusion: Avoid Functions with high Cyclomatic Complexity

The effort and time for diagnosis of deficiencies or causes of failures, or for identification of parts to be modified is directly related to the number of execution paths, i.e. the complexity of the control flow. Analyzability declines with increasing Cyclomatic Complexity. Each modification must be correct for all execution paths. Cyclomatic Complexity computes the number of the linearly independent paths, a lower bound of all execution paths ignoring multiple iterations. Changeability declines with increasing Cyclomatic Complexity. Complete testing requires coverage of all execution paths. Cyclomatic Complexity computes the number of the linearly independent paths, a lower bound of all execution paths ignoring multiple iterations. Testability declines with increasing Cyclomatic Complexity.

Avoid Artifacts with High Cyclomatic Complexity (CC greater than X) Cyclomatic Complexity is a measure of the complexity of the control structure of an Artifact. It is the number of linearly independent paths and therefore, the minimum number of independent paths when executing the software. The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will.
Review the design of the Artifact to reduce number of independent paths. E.g.: Reduce the number of conditional statements.

Carnegie Mellon's Software Engineering Institute on Cyclomatic Complexity http://www.sei.cmu.edu/str/descriptions/cyclomatic_body.html NIST (National Institute of Standards and Technology) Structured Testing: A Testing Methodology Using the Cyclomatic Complexity Metric http://hissa.nist.gov/HHRFdata/Artifacts/ITLdoc/235/sttoc.htm
ColdFusion: Avoid Templates with high Cyclomatic Complexity

The effort and time for diagnosis of deficiencies or causes of failures, or for identification of parts to be modified is directly related to the number of execution paths, i.e. the complexity of the control flow. Analyzability declines with increasing Cyclomatic Complexity. Each modification must be correct for all execution paths. Cyclomatic Complexity computes the number of the linearly independent paths, a lower bound of all execution paths ignoring multiple iterations. Changeability declines with increasing Cyclomatic Complexity. Complete testing requires coverage of all execution paths. Cyclomatic Complexity computes the number of the linearly independent paths, a lower bound of all execution paths ignoring multiple iterations. Testability declines with increasing Cyclomatic Complexity.

Avoid Artifacts with High Cyclomatic Complexity (CC greater than X) Cyclomatic Complexity is a measure of the complexity of the control structure of an Artifact. It is the number of linearly independent paths and therefore, the minimum number of independent paths when executing the software. The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will.
Review the design of the Artifact to reduce number of independent paths. E.g.: Reduce the number of conditional statements.

Carnegie Mellon's Software Engineering Institute on Cyclomatic Complexity http://www.sei.cmu.edu/str/descriptions/cyclomatic_body.html NIST (National Institute of Standards and Technology) Structured Testing: A Testing Methodology Using the Cyclomatic Complexity Metric http://hissa.nist.gov/HHRFdata/Artifacts/ITLdoc/235/sttoc.htm
This report lists all Templates with a Cyclomatic Complexity greater than X. It provides the following information: Template full name, CC
Number of Templates
ColdFusion: Avoid unreferenced Functions

Unreferenced code may be the symptom of Dead Code. Dead Code must be avoided as it makes source code less readable and increases the cost of the software maintenance. Warning: Unreferenced code can also be the symptoms of missing code (code not included in the source code analysis) and / or can be the symptom of use of polymorphism. The intensive use of polymorphism can make the application easier to change but much more difficult to test, debug and stabilize.
All Functions should be referenced. An unreferenced Artifact is an Artifact that is not explicitly called from within the analyzed code.
Check if the Artifact is truly unnecessary. Remove Artifacts that are not used.
This report lists all unreferenced Functions.
Number of Functions
ColdFusion: Avoid unreferenced Templates

Unreferenced code may be the symptom of Dead Code. Dead Code must be avoided as it makes source code less readable and increases the cost of the software maintenance. Warning: Unreferenced code can also be the symptoms of missing code (code not included in the source code analysis) and / or can be the symptom of use of polymorphism. The intensive use of polymorphism can make the application easier to change but much more difficult to test, debug and stabilize.
All Templates should be referenced. An unreferenced Artifact is an Artifact that is not explicitly called from within the analyzed code.
Check if the Artifact is truly unnecessary. Remove Artifacts that are not used.
This report lists all unreferenced Templates.
Number of Templates
ColdFusion: Naming convention on Function
For readability aspects, naming conventions must be respected
Name of Functions should start with prefix
Change name according to the naming convention
This report lists all the Functions not having the desired prefix. Functions full name
Number of Functions
ColdFusion: Naming convention on Query
For readability aspects, naming conventions must be respected
Name of Queries should start with prefix
Change name according to the naming convention
This report lists all the Queries not having the desired prefix. Query full name
Number of Queries
ColdFusion: Naming convention on Template
For readability aspects, naming conventions must be respected
Name of Templates should start with prefix
Change name according to the naming convention
This report lists all the Templates not having the desired prefix. Template full name
Number of Templates
ColdFusion: Avoid code lines longer than 80 characters in Functions
For better readability and portability (printers, terminals, IDE), Artifacts should not have lines longer than 80 characters.
Avoid Functions with lines longer than 80 characters
Consider splitting the line.
This report lists all Functions with lines longer than 80 characters. It provides the following information: Function full name, number of long lines
Number of Functions
ColdFusion: Avoid code lines longer than 80 characters in Templates
For better readability and portability (printers, terminals, IDE), Artifacts should not have lines longer than 80 characters.
Avoid Templates with lines longer than 80 characters
Consider splitting the line.
This report lists all Templates with lines longer than 80 characters. It provides the following information: Template full name, number of long lines
Number of Templates
ColdFusion: Avoid undocumented Functions
Maintainability of the code is facilitated if there is documentation in the code. This rule will ensure there are comments within the Artifact
Functions should have comments
Enrich Artifact code with comments
ColdFusion: Avoid Functions with a low comment/code ratio
Maintainability of the code is facilitated if there is documentation in the code. This rule will ensure there are sufficient comments within the Artifact.
Functions should be documented. This reports shows all the Functions with less than a defined comment / code ratio. This ratio is a parameter of the rule and can be changed at will.
Enrich Artifact code with comments
ColdFusion: Avoid undocumented Templates
Maintainability of the code is facilitated if there is documentation in the code. This rule will ensure there are comments within the Artifact
Templates should have comments
Enrich Artifact code with comments
This report lists all Templates that are not documented. It provides the following information: Template full name
Number of Templates
ColdFusion: Avoid Templates with a low comment/code ratio
Maintainability of the code is facilitated if there is documentation in the code. This rule will ensure there are sufficient comments within the Artifact.
Templates should be documented. This reports shows all the Templates with less than a defined comment / code ratio. This ratio is a parameter of the rule and can be changed at will.
Enrich Artifact code with comments
This report lists all Templates that have a low comment / code ratio. It provides the following information: Template full name, comment / code ratio
Number of Templates
ColdFusion: Avoid using SQL queries inside a loop
Number of Templates
ColdFusion: Avoid instanciation in loop
Number of Templates
ColdFusion: Avoid using cffile for file access
<cffile> is slow for large file access.
This rule report all us of <cffile>, whatever the size of the file.
Either use the new CF8 "File" functions or hand off the task to Java on CF6 & 7.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1191131/common-programming-mistakes-for-coldfusion-programmer-to-avoid http://www.raymondcamden.com/index.cfm/2011/2/8/Comparing-different-ways-of-writing-out-large-amounts-of-data
This report lists all Templates that .use <cffile>. It provides the following information: - Template full name - Number of cffile
Number of Templates
ColdFusion: Avoid Queries with COUNT(*) statement

A query that retrieves all columns of a table with a SELECT * can potentially be the source of important performance problems: Such performance problems may arise when the execution of the query returns a large result sets (many row with all the columns may then become a huge amount of data to transport over the network). Thus optimzer module can't provide a correct execution. Also, when using such queries, one cannot control how the columns will be ordered and returned to the client. This can lead to important data inconsistencies and thus stability issues.
This metric retrieves the artifacts containing queries using the "SELECT *" statement.
Review the design of the query to select only useful Columns
This report lists all "SELECT *" queries. It provides the following information: CFQueries full name
Number of CFQueries
ColdFusion: Avoid Queries using JOINS on more than 4 Tables
Queries with joins based on a large number of tables can cause performance problems.
This report lists all CFQueries with SQL statement using JOINS on more than 4 tables. It provides the following information: CFQueries full name
Number of CFQueries
ColdFusion: Avoid Queries using GROUP BY
Having complex queries in artifacts can cause performance problems. Queries using GROUP BY is considered complex and not efficient.
Templates should not use GROUP BY clause in SQL statement
Review the design of the query to avoid if possible GROUP BY clause
CAST Consulting
This report lists all CFQueries with SQL statement using GROUP BY clause. It provides the following information: CFQueries full name
Number of CFQueries
ColdFusion: Avoid Queries with SELECT * statement

A query that retrieves all columns of a table with a SELECT * can potentially be the source of important performance problems: Such performance problems may arise when the execution of the query returns a large result sets (many row with all the columns may then become a huge amount of data to transport over the network). Thus optimzer module can't provide a correct execution. Also, when using such queries, one cannot control how the columns will be ordered and returned to the client. This can lead to important data inconsistencies and thus stability issues.
Templates should not use SELECT * in SQL statement
Review the design of the query to select only useful Columns
This report lists all "SELECT *" queries It provides the following information: CFQueries full name
Number of CFQueries
ColdFusion: Avoid Queries with Subqueries
Having complex queries in SQL Artifacts can cause performance problems. Queries with Subqueries are considered complex.
SQL Artifacts should not use SQL statement including Subqueries (at least subqueries should be avoided).
Review the design of the query to avoid if possible Subqueries
This report lists all CFQueries with SQL statement including Subqueries. It provides the following information: CFQueries full name
Number of CFQueries
ColdFusion: Avoid Queries using NOT EXISTS
Having complex queries in artifacts can cause performance problems. Queries using NOT EXISTS is considered complex and not efficient.
Templates should not use NOT EXIST clause in SQL statement
Review the design of the query to avoid if possible NOT IN clause. Consider using OUTER JOIN is test prove it is more efficient in performance and readability
http://sql-server-performance.com/Community/forums
This report lists all CFQueries with SQL statement using NOT EXISTS clause. It provides the following information: CFQueries full name
Number of CFQueries
ColdFusion: Prefer UNION ALL to UNION

In SQL the UNION operator combines the results of two SQL queries into a single table of all matching rows. The two queries must have matching fields and data types in order to join them. Any duplicate records are automatically removed unless UNION ALL is used. The problem is that MOST of the time it is unecessary to remove duplicate as there are none and doing the search for duplicate rows can be very costly.
List all CFqueries using UNION (without ALL).
Add the ALL after the union keyword (ensure that this does not change the returned data).
Standard suggestions based on CAST Quality Model

select C1a, C2a from Table1 union // VIOLATION select C1b, C2b from Table2
-- The database server will read the values, sort them and eliminate duplicates. This is costly and likely to be useless.
select C1a, C2a from Table1 union ALL // FIXED select C1b, C2b from Table2
This report lists all CFQueries with SQL statement using UNION clause only. It provides the following information: CFQueries full name
Number of CFQueries
ColdFusion: Avoid Queries using NOT IN
Having complex queries in artifacts can cause performance problems. Queries using NOT IN is considered complex and not efficient.
Templates should not use NOT IN clause in SQL statement
Review the design of the query to avoid if possible NOT IN clause. Consider using OUTER JOIN is test prove it is more efficient in performance and readability
http://sql-server-performance.com/Community/forums
This report lists all CFQueries with SQL statement using NOT IN clause. It provides the following information: - CFQueries full name - Count of NOT IN
Number of CFQueries
ColdFusion: Avoid Break in loops
A FOR loop must be straightfoward to read. Using break statements in FOR loops makes them much more difficult to read.
Number of Templates
ColdFusion: Avoid Templates with more than X Functions
For maintainability and readability reasons, Templates should not have too many Functions
Templates should have less than X Functions The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will.
Review the Template design to reduce the number of Functions
This report lists all the Templates having more than X Functions. It provides the following information: - Template full name - Number of Functions
Number of Templates
ColdFusion: Avoid Functions with more then XX Lines of Code
Large Functions are more difficult to understand, and are a sign of a bad modularity of the code
Functions should not have more than X lines of code. The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will.
Review the design of the Function to reduce its size
This report lists all Functions with more than X lines of code. It provides the following information: - Function full name - Number of lines of code
Number of Functions
ColdFusion: Avoid Templates with more then XX Lines of Code
Large Templates are more difficult to understand, and are a sign of a bad modularity of the code
Templates should not have more than X lines of code. The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will.
Review the design of the Template to reduce its size
This report lists all Template with more than X lines of code. It provides the following information: - Template full name - Number of lines of code
Number of Templates
